intro: Polycarena parvula, commonly known as the small polycarp, is a small flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compact stature and clustered leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its native range.
